comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: This photo is part of an ongoing digitization and research project at the Smithsonian Institution Archives. Please help us research this photo. View a related blog post here - blog.photography.si.edu/2009/03/30/who-are-you/

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content: Is there any possibility that the surname is a typo or a misreading of a handwritten label? I have found a Bird (or Birdie) Stein Gans (1868-1944), wife of Howard S. Gans. She was one of the founders of the Society for the Study of Child Nature. jwa.org/encyclopedia/article/gans-bird-stein www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/judaica/ejud_0002_00... Formerly married to Louis Sternberger, but divorced him to marry Gans in 1908 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9401E7D8153EE233A... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B03E0DA153EE233A... Bird (Stein) Gans was a cousin of Gertrude Stein.

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content:
Right is the 1924 passport photo for Bird Stein Gans - is this the same woman?
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/vintagepix/3408851274/]
Source: U.S. Passport Applications, 1795-1925, NARA film series #M1490, Roll 2419, certificate #367137 signed 24 January 1924.

comment.author: 39312862@N00
comment._content: Does a scan of the handwriting on the archive item exist?

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content: Bird Stein Gans' passport photo overlaid on Mrs. Howard S. Gaus: Not very scientific - I tried to line the faces up on the eyes. I really need to stop thinking about this and go do some real work!

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: I just consulted the original image and you are indeed correct, Vintagepix! The handwriting was misread as Gaus rather than Gans. Thanks!

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content: Yay! Glad you could confirm that! (It's a very common transcription error.)

comment.author: 75971410@N00
comment._content: Yeah! mystery solved thanks to vintagepix

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: See the blog post about your detective work, vintagepix! blog.photography.si.edu/2009/04/24/case-closed-on-bird-st...

comment.author: 46681937@N00
comment._content: It is perhaps worth mentioning that she was a cousin of Gertrude Stein.
